meanings.definition: Remove or take out (something) from a place.
meanings.sent1: I need to extract the toy from the box.
meanings.sent2: The dentist will extract my tooth tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I tried to extract the last cookie from the jar, but it got stuck!
meanings.sent4: She managed to extract the truth from his lies.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to extract the key evidence from the suspect's alibi.

meanings.definition: Obtain (a substance or resource) from a material.
meanings.sent1: We can extract oil from olives.
meanings.sent2: Miners extract valuable minerals from the earth.
meanings.sent3: I tried to extract some luck from my lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: She managed to extract useful information from the old documents.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to extract DNA from the blood sample.
